												I saw this game and figured, well I really like WWII, enjoy flight games, and it's free, I guess I might as well try it. Boy was that a mistake. To say this game is a simulation game is an insult to even the worst flight sims out there. You have two directions of movement. Up and down, Left or Right. Essentially you only have Pitch and Yaw. They attempt to make it look like you have roll by automatically in the direction your turning, but that's it. Also, you pitch stops at the 180 degree mark. You can go straight up or straight down, but you can't do a loop of any kind. So basically you can't preform even the most basic of combat manoeuvers. In other words the controls are very basic, which you would think would be a good thing for a casual game, but it goes against even the most basic principles of slight. As far long term gameplay and progression, I really can't say much as I never intend to play this game again. Seriously, if you are interested in a free WWII flight sim, go for Warthunder. Much better graphics, much better controls, basically much better everything. And you can even drive tanks too! Seriously guys, avoid this one like the plague. World of Warplanes is significantly better than this, and that's saying A LOT!

												EDIT: This is a day after my initial review. The Steam version is worse than the original version, and their website is formatted so badly, I thought I was at the wrong place. Seriously, that is NOT English (even if you do set it to America/UK) This was fun when I was 8 and had no other games to play and was a F2P scrub.(Original): I remember playing this game back when I was in elementary school on Windows XP. I even invited some of my friends to play with me. I had 2 main characters, both high levels. Then came along more realistic simulators, WoT, World of Warplanes, and the most popular (and my favorite), WarThunder. Comparing this game to War Thunder is like comparing the 1998 Half-Life to Portal 2 or Counter Strike:Global Offensive; it's dated, but it doesn't stop there. When I was younger, I didn't notice all of the horrid mis-translations(or just bad grammar) because I knew no better. The gameplay is either a tad interesting or boring out of your mind. You can play with up to 4 online players (friends, or an open lobby) or by yourself in a mission that has bad AI with the standard guns you get in the game, which suck. Somtimes you can pickup drops from enemies witch go into your inventory, which you can use to upgrade or build equipment or IS equipment, that being said, there is a rarity scale for items. On the topic of Missions, there are 8 chapters, each of them holding about 20 missions each, with (almost)the same exact enemies. You can also participate in online tournements, where a LV1 person will sometimes glich into existence and TAKE OUT YOUR TEAM OF WELL 'EXPERIENCD' LV70s FOR SOME REASON(because there are supposed to be level gaps in the tournement lobbies you can participate in).Not much else to say. It's like WarThunder, it has squads n'stuff and you shoot down other players sometimes.P.S. To get my old account back, I had to install the online launchers game over the Steam version so it would give me the option to login on startup. Good example of a game where I don't want to give it a good or bad rating, but I'll say this: try it, and read the bad aswell as the good reviews and decide for yourself.

Posted: June 20, 2015
												HIS is a very misunderstood game. When in first came out in the late 00s it was a novelty, there wasn't another game like it. However it was very niche, and still is. What you need to remember is that this game is nothing like World of Warplanes or War Thunder. Those can loosely be called action simulators. HIS is a third person action shooter with a world war two aerial combat theme to it. THere is next to no relism except for the names of the aircraft. It has its flaws. The graphics are retro in a bad way, the sounds are as well. You really have to be interested in dogfights and arena combat games to get the most out of this. Its good point is that it is fun if you go into it with an open mind and no predetermined expectations. The only thing HIS has in common with Warthunder is the same as what Assassin's Creed and Dead Space have in common. They are both games.

												Alright, what can I say about this game. First things first, it's a plane game, probably blindingly obvious, but it's what TYPE of plane game I need to adress. I can easily say, it's not a simulater, those tags are lying to you, it may TRY to be realistic but it's just not. It plays actually alright, although most of the mission are extremely easy, even with only 2 players, but the game runs alright. I definetely noticed a LOT of problems, unlike games like War Thunder (I'll be comparing these 2 games a lot) you can't actually do loops, or rolls, or really anything that involves you flipping over. Also most planes/blimps are not physical, weird but true. There is custimization, but as far as I can see, the custimization doesn't really affect the gameplay. Now, the menus. Their clunky and jumbled and the main menu is an assortment of buildings from a top down veiw (kind of like Kerbal Space Program except executed poorly) and there is this weird... club penguin kind of thing were instead of from the top down veiw your in your plane and you just drive around the place and can select the buildings from there, but I don't know why anyone wants to do that. Something else I want to point out is the graphics are like microsoft flight simulater back in 2000! It's not even close to comparible with War Thunder or World of Warplanes.I gave it a 4/10, a bad thing about this is it released itself in the time of War Thunder, and World of Warplanes, it really doesn't have a place here, nothing here can compare itself with any of those games. I recomend instead of coming here and scraping the bottom of the barrel, you go out there and get War Thunder or World of Warplanes. I guarantee you'll have a better experience. 												Okay, let's get these facts straight and true:- HIS/HITS is NOT designed to be a SIMULATION at ALL.- There are controls for mouse, Gamepad, and Keyboard only. I have personally verified all 3- This game is by NO MEANS P2W, I can NOT STAND those PoS games that are (WoT/WoWP) -There is a full screen mode, it is in the settings, so try and actually LOOK AROUND for what you are complaining about!!!Most of the negative reviews are by those who simply hop in for 5-10 minutes, find no outright eye-candy, and come in with undue bias towards anyhting remotely non-SIM.!!! So far, EVERY complaint listed by the top 15 Negative Reviews are non-existant, or outright clouded by wrong expectations.Now for the review:  HITS is a game GREAT for those who are looking for a fun, laid-back MMO based on ~1930s-1950s aircraft, whether Prototypes, Paper Planes, or "normal" military aircraft. This game is by no means a looker, but is well optimized for laptop users and those with aging desktops. Hell, I can run it with my backup Integrated GPU on my spare laptop with no lag. (2.5 GhZ OC)The game is somewhat faction based, with you being a PMC allied with either the Axis Nations or the Allied Nations, with you being able to make a character for both factions if you so choose. You get 3 Nations aircraft, regardless of which "Nation" You choose, in addition to Gunners [Heavy Fighters] and Bombers, [Dive Bombers, and traditional level-flight types] and these trees are quite fleshed out, and, if they continue bringing in aircraft from the Original HITS, there will be many more.The economy is quite easy to adapt to, and is partly player driven through trading of just about everything (Recommended way of buying things outright) and requires not a single dime of your $$$ to enjoy. All you can buy with real cash is minor details such as nose art, or minor other details for your aircraft which offer anything from 10% increased EXP to 10% Increased Drop Rates for missions. There is no Premium membership [!!!!] and nothing is more than a few $$ to buy.Cons:-Some questionable translations, though if you speak Deutsch it is fine- Minor text issues on item drops, but is easily negated.- Ok Graphics, but not designed to be a showhorse of such.Overall, I would rate at 8.5-9.0 out of 10.

												At first when I saw all the negative reviews, I didn't want to download this game, but then I saw a positive review saying that the game isn't meant to be realistic or like war thunder in any way. So I thought: Well since most of the negative reviews hates on the game's flight models and stuff, and the game isn't supposed to be realistic, and it's actually supposed to be an MMORPG but with planes, I decided to give it a shot. Here are the pros and cons:Pros: - Easy to learn         - Don't have to pay to win or to have fun         - Tons of planes          - Tons of missions         - Missions can be played in co-op, or alone         - PvP and PvE modes         - Can run smoothly on any computer         - No lag          - Easy to level up         - Easy to get new upgrades         - Not a grind fest, making money and getting unlocks and rewards is quick and easy.         - Lots of parts and items to upgrade your plane with         - Storage warehouse for un-used items         - Tons of Quests that gives you bonus rewards         - Extremely detailed tutorial quests to teach you how to play the game         - Fun to playCons: - The game's graphics look like it's from 1996          - The damage model is just a simple health bar, no individual components that can take damage          - Can't do barrel rolls or loops          - No plane engine sounds          - All guns sounds the same          - You can fly through enemies without taking damage          - Only 3 different death animations for planes, 1: The plane's engines starts burning, and a wing breaks off, and the plane spirals to the ground and explodes. 2: The plane's engines starts burning, and the plane spirals to the ground and explodes. 3: The plane doesn't burn or anything, it just spirals to the ground and explodes.          - No throttle control Overall I find it fun to play the game, even though the controls and gameplay is really simple and easy, and the graphics are from the 1990's. It just feels fun to play, and there's a lot of content. Even more content than some AAA games. It has almost as much content as War Thunder. Lots of maps, planes, missions, weapons, upgrades, and so on. If this game had tanks like War Thunder, then I would say they have the same amount of content. It's still a great game though.Long story short: Great game, great fun, tons of content, no grinding for money or levels, you should totally try it out!

												A video review I also made:


YouTube™ Video: A Look At: HIS (Heroes In The Sky) For Steam 

			Views: 68		

			A review-kind of video that gives you a decent look of Heroes In The Sky, a very underrated arcade flight game with WW2 planes.		

This game does NOT deserve the negativity it gets!To make things clear:-This is not a new release, but more like a revived game since it came on steam.-It's a pure ARCADE game.I am already facepalming at the amount of negative reviews I am reading here on steam, people comparing this game to War Thunder?WT is a simulator, this is an ARCADE game, which is like comparing apples and pears.I have also seen people putting cons for this game as "unlimited ammo" or "no wind effects", which is even more cringe worthy to read.Only because this is an arcade game doesn't mean it's a bad game.So I have played this in the past before it was on Steam, and boy have I missed it and I'm happy to see it back since it's great fun!The graphics are, since it's an older title pretty outdated, although the models of your own plane look suprisingly decent in my opinion.But the gameplay is where the good stuff is, that is, if you like arcade games.You get to fly in WW2 planes that fly fast and are really manouverable, aka, that fly really arcady, hence again, I keep stating this is an arcade game at it's purest.You get to do little compaign missions of events in WW2, either alone or with a group of friends. After getting ranks in missions you get exp and cash and unlock harder difficulties for each single mission. On each mission you also get a rank like D, C, B, A and Ace, which gives some replay value if you want to get high rankings.Not to mention there are tons of quests per mission that will grant you additional exp and ingame cash.You research different planes in tech trees from different countries. You can make up to 3 characters in the game, and with each character you can either choose Allies and Axis. The Allies consisting of American, Russian and British planes, and the Axis consisting of German, Italian and Japanese planes. Each country having their own tech tree.Then there are also different heavy fighter and bomber tech trees.After you research a plane, you buy it, and will always be able to select your previous planes if you so desire. You will never lose any of them.The upgrades of planes are universal, as in you get Engine1 and Gun2 on your plane, then switch to another plane, that same Engine1 and Gun2 will be equipped on that plane.There is item crafting that you can make with spare parts you get from rewards during missions.There is also PVP, however I haven't played that yet since I prefer to just do coop missions with friends.The best thing about this game is in my opinion the feeling you get when you just mow away a group of planes with your machine guns or rockets. Highly unrealistic, but very satisying, and acceptable since it's an arcade game.All in all a very fun little arcady WW2 plane game with a lot of missions to do either alone or with friends, constantly upgrading weapons, engines, armor and other stuff while trying to get higher level planes. Definately a good time waster if you want to put your brain on 0 and just shoot down hordes of planes, either alone or with friends!I'm very sad to see all the negative comments it gets, or the stupid comparisons to War Thunder. It's not comparable.Play this if you want to mow down enemies with your brain put to 0 and have a laugh with some friends.If you want to have a more realistic experience where strategy is key, then yes, I suggest a game as War Thunder, but i'm not saying that one game is better than the other, because these are not comparable.

I played this way before it was on Steam, immediately before school, etc, etc. I'd make an estimate of at least 50 or more hours spent.This game is, to me, a good example of an arcade. It is not meant to be realistic; that would be for the simulators, like War Thunder, World of Warplanes, or DSC World. It is not meant to be realistic; it's meant to enjoy the murdering of your enemy as you spam machineguns and missiles (which are mildly seeking).Those who complain about the graphical aspects...it's graphics suck. I will be blatantly honest, they are flat, and at times, they suck. The people do not look realistic. For all sakes, it is from 2007, and graphics aren't everything. That's like watching pornography for the good storyline. You are enjoying the gameplay...for all sake, people play Minecraft, Terraria, and others, and they do not have the best graphics. To me, that is just a plus...means my PC can actually run it.I think this game is bombarded by twits who do not understand the concept nor the time; it was 2007.11/10, I will continue to play.EDITOK, so I've played it for a while and...this game is not the one I played before. Lemme explain.There are multiple errors in the game. First off, and most apparent, is the grammar. This might not be such a great issue...but as I said, I played it before. The Gamescampus version did not have those issues, and changing what is clearly a done job to a worse job is not good. In addition, in the Axis tech tree, certain Japanese aircraft are named in German. That is NOT what you do, and annoying. Again, minor yet was not present in the previous version.Next off is the 'supply missions'. This involves flying-about and going through floating boxes made of wood. This is random, to me. It's also not fun, because all you are doing is flying. No, that is not good gameplay.Next is the gameplay actions. In certain missions, the GM can choose what they want to do. This usually involves certain class-oriented goals, like 'Attack retreating troops' or 'another target is spotted'. This, this I like. It provides a certain amount of choice in the player's day. For those who don't know, these are jet fighters Germany fielded near the end of the war. As such, they suck in a turning-battle, yet are amazing in a run-and-gun scenario. I'm in a prop plane. 												Heroes In The Sky has been around for some years now. There's a lot of things that have changed since when I last played it. Today I returned to it after 4 years and my first thought "Wow. This game has changed so much." I can't really say that all of the changes have been good and there's a lot of things that need improving.First of all the language.It appears to me that a Japanease company have taken over the game. This isn't a bad thing however the translations are somewhat sloppy and the text boxes need a big overhaul. The text is scattered all across the interface. In missions the text can be a bit urghh.. It needs sorting out.. And there's a lot to do.InterfaceThings are scattered around everywhere and it's a little overwhelming, especially to new players. It takes a lot of getting used to as well, even for returning players. It may be a wise idea help give the inerface a cleaner look and appeal - everwhereGraphicsThe graphical quality remains the same as it did years ago. This doesn't matter too much but they could do with being updated - higher resolution and quality of images rather than just settling with a lazy 2D look to various npcs that are found in the game. The game could do with 'Borderless Fullscreen' and a 'automatic resolution' detection option for optimal resolution settings.SoundMy only problem with the sound is that there's this HORRIBLE buzzing noise when airplanes get very close. Please remove it. It's not a 'problem' as such but it's uncomfortable to listen to.TradingOh my word... This is more of a community thing but if you're really into trading then you may find yourself facepalming repeatidly when trading with other players... Expect lots of skyhigh prices for easy to get items... By 'skyhigh' I mean 450,000,000 ghems for simple items... To point out.. you get maybe 5,000 ghems per mission if you're lucky... So yeah... If you want money quickly then pick a specialisation/skill and hone it. Make rare items and sell them. Doing so then allows you to buy expensive items.. In a nutshell people don't know how to trade.Premium ItemsI think this is what is going to get the attention of a lot of people so i'll try to add extra detail where possible.To summerise: The game is not pay to win from what I can tell so far. You can use premium currency to aid you in levelling up but there's still quite a bit of work you have to do. You can buy boosters and so forth. Premium planes which can be purchased with premium currency can help you a lot. There's no need in spending loads of money on the game though.$10 or around £6.75 can give you a premium membership which should be more than enough to stablize you and to give you a decent shot at getting your hands on a premium plane. If the premium membership is exactly as stated then It would be something that I suggest everyone gets, however I am unsure how long the premium lasts for, this is something that needs clarification. Premium currency will get you places though however you can get to the same places without it. It is definately not a 'need'.Summary:The game has been around for years, it's about time it was added to steam. I personally had to start from scratch but that's no matter. The game itself hasn't changed too much and there are several issues that need addressing. The game should run very smoothly on a lot of machines are it is not too graphically demanding. However lower fps may be expected on the more advanced mission due to the high npc count in missions.Membership is entirely your choice, I do have a feeling that it is perminant as well. The game itself isn't too bad, however there are plenty of areas for improvement. It's fun to play casually but there's not a whole lot for hardcore players, and those players in particular may be disappointed.Overall I recommend this game because it's fun to play and is a little different compared to other games around. It's enjoyable and with a bit of work from the developers and a bit of community growth then the game will become very fun. For now the game and the community is sleeping like a lot of old games.
